intro: Drosanthemum wittebergense, commonly known as the Witteberg drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and nutrient-poor soils. Drosanthemum wittebergense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in xerophytic gardens.
